title: Buy 3 February Dogs Of The Dow, Watch 2 More
text: "The Dow® [adds a stock] if the company has an excellent reputation, demonstrates sustained growth, and is of interest to a large number of investors. Sector representation.is also a consideration.” – Dow Jones & Co. The highest-yield 10 are February's Dogs of the Dow: KO, CSCO, AMGN, CVX, DOW, IBM, INTC, MMM, WBA, and VZ, averaging a 4.41% annual yield.

title: AbbVie Q4 Preview: What's in Store?
text: AbbVie has put in a mixed earnings performance, exceeding bottom line estimates in five consecutive quarters but falling short of sales expectations in each instance.

title: Why Apple Stock Gained 11% in January

title: Making Sense of Apple, Amazon and Big Tech Earnings
text: The market's contrasting reactions to December-quarter results from the 'Big 5 Tech Players' - Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, Meta & Microsoft - provides us with useful clues as to what is most important to investors in these mega-cap players.

title: Apple Pay gets the green light to launch its service in South Korea
text: A South Korean financial regulator said on Friday that the country had approved the Apple Pay launch to allow local credit card firms to introduce the Apple Pay service.

title: Google, Apple, Amazon give investors reason to fret
text: Wall Street has its eyes on big tech after some of the biggest companies in the world posted lackluster quarterly financial performances.

title: ETFs in Focus on Apple's First Earnings Miss Since 2016
text: Apple missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate for earnings for the first time since 2016. It posted its largest year-over-year quarterly revenue decline since 2019 and the biggest annual quarterly revenue drop since September 2016.

title: Why Apple Stock Was Up on Friday
text: The iPhone maker now has an installed base of over 2 billion active devices.

title: Apple (AAPL) Q1 Earnings Miss Estimates, Revenues Decline Y/Y
text: Apple's (AAPL) first-quarter fiscal 2023 results reflect the supply shortage of iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max in November and through December, and a significant forex headwind.

text: Jefferies sees any weakness in Apple stock as a "more appealing buying opportunity." Apple's Q1 earnings and revenue missed expectations.

text: Just one day after the Nasdaq and S&P 500 got a boost from Meta Platforms' (META) fourth-quarter report, the market is reacting to the quarterly results from three other Big Tech giants.

title: Apple is producing more. But now the worries are who will buy?
text: With COVID-19 supply constraints in the rear-view mirror, Apple Inc. is, in a way, just like any other company.

title: Apple's Dividend: 10 Years Later
text: I am sure most of us have looked at our childhood or adolescent photos and wondered "Wow, was that me and my friends? We sure have grown up. And our neighborhood was so different too. But Mr. Smith hasn't aged a bit, still looks strong."

title: Apple gets upgraded price target from Wedbush analysts even in the face of fiscal Q1 expectations misses
text: Shares of Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) are on pace to open about 2% lower after the company's fiscal first-quarter results missed on earnings and revenue — but that hasn't stopped analysts at Wedbush from upping its price target for the company.  The firm issued an Outperform rating and increased its price target to $180 from $175.

title: Apple's long-term positives outweigh rare earnings miss, Morgan Stanley says
text: Apple's top and bottom line misses don't change the underlying bullish thesis for the company, Morgan Stanley analysts said.

title: Apple Sees Improved Outlook After iPhone Supply Issues Resolved
text: After missing its December-quarter targets due to iPhone supply shortages, Apple said production has returned to normal. The post Apple Sees Improved Outlook After iPhone Supply Issues Resolved appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: Apple's Earnings, Expectations and Surprises
text: Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) is set to report earnings for the first quarter of the fiscal year 2023 after this evening's closing bell. As one of the world's largest and most influential tech companies, Apple's earnings report is always highly anticipated by investors and industry experts.

title: Apple, Alphabet and Amazon stock selloff would reduce their market caps by more than $150 billion combined
text: The selloff in the shares of AAA technology behemoths — Apple Inc., Alphabet Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. — that reported quarterly results overnight are shaving off a combined $158.5 billion from the companies' market capitalizations. But that loss would be just about 38% of what the $254.5 billion gained the day before earnings were reported.

title: Apple Stock Falls After Earnings
text: Apple reported disappointing earnings results.

title: Here's What Key Metrics Tell Us About Apple (AAPL) Q1 Earnings
text: While the top- and bottom-line numbers for Apple (AAPL) give a sense of how the business performed in the quarter ended December 2022, it could be worth looking at how some of its key metrics compare to Wall Street estimates and year-ago values.

title: U.S. stock futures tumble ahead of jobs data, with tech under pressure as Apple, Amazon and Alphabet fall after results
text: U.S. stock futures fell Friday ahead of an important update on the labor market, with tech bearing the brunt of losses following disappointing results from Amazon.com, Apple and Alphabet.

title: Apple, Amazon and Alphabet expose difficult reality of after two days of tech gains
text: After two days of markets being led higher by tech stocks, giants Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL), Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) and Google owner Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOG) all delivered disappointing earnings that showed the situation is less than rosy. Three of the world's largest companies falling short of Wall Street estimates confirmed the impact of declining consumer confidence as the global economic outlook remains uncertain.
